html.p: This section describes Zero Install in general rather than giving details specific to either of the implementations. If you want help using one of them, jump to that section instead:

dl.dd: The injector is a pure Python implementation of Zero Install. It provides the 0launch command, and can be installed by anyone.

The filesystem uses a kernel module to provide the /uri/0install filesystem. This only works on Linux, and you need to be root to install it (but once installed other software can be fetched by non-root users).

html.p: You should also click on one of the two links above if you're looking for screenshots. There is also a matrix comparing various different installation systems for a quick overview of how Zero Install compares with other systems.
